question: 折り紙
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>折る</ja> is "to fold," so what about "to fold <kanji>paper</kanji>"? Ever heard of something that involves lots of folding of paper that is Japanese? Most likely you have. This is <vocabulary>origami</vocabulary>, aka the <vocabulary>art of paper folding</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>折る</ja> and the vocab word <ja>紙</ja>. As long as you know those you should be able to read this. Also, you probably already know this reading because it's an English word, too.
